title: Hypertensive heart disease: is it really a pathology?
summary: Hypertensive heart disease is not a direct cause of heart failure. Left ventricular hypertrophy is common in hypertension but rarely progresses to HFpEF or HFrEF. ...
abstract: Hypertensive heart disease is not a direct cause of heart failure. Left ventricular hypertrophy is common in hypertension but rarely progresses to HFpEF or HFrEF. The true cardiovascular consequences of hypertension are primarily mediated by atherosclerosis and microvascular dysfunction, leading to stroke and myocardial infarction.
